page.title: 02LOCAL GEOGRAPHY.
page.content: THE BLOCK STUDIED IS SITUATED UPON THE SOUTH EAST CORNER OF THE{MAGNESIUM {LIMESTONE ESCARPMENT,}A PROMINENT GEOLOGICAL FEATURE OF COUNTY DURHAM. THE BLOCK IS RURAL AND THEREFORE THE MAJOR INDUSTRY IS THAT OF{AGRICULTURE. THE MAJORITY OF FARMS ARE MIXED,THE MAIN CROPS BEING CEREALS,POTATOES AND OILRAPE SEED.THE MAIN INDUSTRY IN THE PAST WAS{COAL MINING}BUT THIS HAS DECLINED WITH THE CLOSING OF THE LOCAL COLLIERY.SOME{LIGHT INDUSTRY}\IS BEING DEVELOPED BUT THIS IS ONLY TO A SMALL DEGREE.UNEMPLOYMENT IS ABOVE NATIONAL AVERAGE.THE BLOCKS MAIN DRAINAGE IS THE{RIVER SKERNE,}A SMALL RIVER,AND ITS TRIBUTARIES.THE BLOCK IS SERVED BY 2 C CLASS ROADS AND ONE B CLASS ROAD {(B1278).}THIS RUNS NORTH SOUTH LINKING THE TWO MAIN BUILT-UP AREAS OF{ {FISHBURN}VILLAGE AND{TRIMDON}VILLAGE.
